page.title: 03SPRING FARMING AT CARSPHAIRN
page.content: {LAMBING}In April the lambing begins.Most of the lambs are Blackface and most are born on the hills. Some of the other lambs are born in the fields around the house.In May the lambing has just about finished.If there is anything wrong with the ewe the lambs are brought in to be bottle fed.Sometimes the ewes die from lack of calcium, and then the lambs are often twinned on to a ewe whose lambs have died.The ewes have to be checked about twice a day. {GATHERING}After about two months the ewes and lambs are gathered and taken into pens to be marked.The tup lambs are castrated.Some farmers use rubber bands, others use bardizzos.This stops them from breeding and also helps them to put on more weight.
